intro: Scorzonera transitoria, commonly known as the transient scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant is perennial and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Scorzonera transitoria has a short growing season, blooming in late spring to early summer before the weather becomes too hot. Its root system is fibrous, and it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
